article.title: Dissecting the IRX - $β$ dust attenuation relation: exploring the physical origin of observed variations in galaxies

multiple_choice_question.text: Which dust attenuation curve exhibits the strongest increase in absorption at wavelengths less than 2000 Å?
What does the 2175 Å feature correspond to in the context of dust attenuation curves?
choices: A decrease in absorption due to scattering by dust grains
An emission feature from interstellar gas
A characteristic bump in absorption due to the presence of specific dust grain types
A change in the slope of the attenuation curve at high redshifts

multiple_choice_question.text: What happens to the IRX-β relation as the age of the stellar population increases?
choices: The relation shifts to larger values of UV-slope β
The relation shifts to lower values of UV-slope β

multiple_choice_question.text: Which dust type results in a flatter IRX-β relation compared to the MW dust type?
choices: All dust types result in a similar IRX-β relation
The age of the stellar population is the main driver of the shape of the IRX-β relation

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the effect of increasing turbulence within the dust screen on the IRX-β relation?
choices: It shifts the relation to lower values of both β and IRX
It shifts the relation above the relation for a homogeneous dust screen

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following physical processes does NOT cause deviations in the IRX-β relation towards bluer UV colors at a fixed IRX?
